newsitem.title: USA: Champion Parts sets restructuring plan.
newsitem.headline: Champion Parts sets restructuring plan.

text.p: Champion Parts Inc said Monday it reached a preliminary restructuring agreement with a panel representing some of its unsecured creditors.
The comany said the pact calls for the company to pay $1.7 million to settle about $5.5 million in unsecured liabilities.

Champion said it plans to use existing cash reserves and a proposed cash infusion of $1.2 million from Raymond Perelman, one of its directors. Perelman would receive one million new common shares, warrants to buy an additional two million shares at $0.50 each and a $275,000, partially secured interest-bearing note.
Perelman would also be allowed to designate a majority of Champion's board, the company said.
The settlement is subject to ratification by the unsecured creditors and the finalization of the agreements with Perlman, Champion said.
The company makes fuel cells and other automotive parts.
